item.title: Interlude - Egon Schiele at the Museo Nacional Thyssen-Bornemisza
item.description: Maybe it’s bad taste, maybe it’s cliché to use this artist for a pandemic-inspired post. Egon Schiele is one of the most famous victims of the 1919 Spanish Flu outbreak, dying aged 28, three days after his pregnant wife. While he’s best-known for his tormented, electrically-hued, sinewy nudes, Schiele left a considerable legacy in landscape painting, too. How many new town scenes would he have painted, had the flu not cut him down?
